result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan E Leyva was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Juan E Leyva is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Juan E Leyva was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

AMENDED SIGNATURE BOND - CONDITIONS MODIFIED
- Your signature bond is set in the amount of $1000 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant may resume residence in his apartment in the 4500th block of Golf Rd in Windsor, WI.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Georgiana S, except Defendant may be present at a common worksite with victim Georgiana S
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- The Court finds substantial evidence that knowing and malicious prevention or dissuasion of the above victim(s) is reasonably likely to occur.  The above conditions of release are hereby ordered pursuant to Sec. 940.47 and Chapter 969.

AMENDED SIGNATURE BOND - CONDITIONS MODIFIED
- The court orders a Signature Bond in the amount of $1000.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his release from jail.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $2000.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
